summary: This bill, the Zuni Indian Tribe Water Rights Settlement Act of 2025, aims to settle water rights claims of the Zuni Tribe in New Mexico. It ratifies an existing agreement, establishes a trust fund for the tribe, and outlines the management of federal land, including the Zuni Salt Lake and Sanctuary. The bill withdraws certain federal lands from mineral and other uses to protect the Zuni Salt Lake. It authorizes funds for agreement implementation and details waivers of claims and the Enforceability Date. The bill also specifies the terms of land transfers into trust for the Tribe and mandates the preparation of related maps and legal descriptions.
